identificationModule.briefTitle: Long-Term Safety Study of CTX0E03 in Subjects Who Completed PISCES III Study
identificationModule.officialTitle: Long-Term Safety Study of CTX0E03 in Subjects Who Completed PISCES III Study

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this long-term safety study is to follow up subjects treated with CTX0E03 DP to monitor for delayed oncological, neurological, and CTX0E03 DP-related adverse events and to monitor survival
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The goal of this study is to assess the long-term safety of subjects treated with intracerebral CTX0E03 DP as measured by the onset of delayed adverse events of special interest (AESIs). AESIs are defined as adverse events leading to death, new oncological adverse events, new neurological adverse events and any other adverse event, which in the opinion of the Safety/Project Physician is related to CTX0E03 DP.

interventions.name: Non Interventional long term safety follow up
interventions.description: Non Interventional long term safety follow up

primaryOutcomes.measure: Long-term safety study is to follow up subjects treated with CTX0E03 DP
primaryOutcomes.description: Identify delayed oncological, neurological, and CTX0E03 DP-related adverse events and to monitor survival.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

Subjects who have received CTX0E03 DP as part of the active arm in the PISCES III study Have provided appropriate written informed consent

Exclusion Criteria:

* None
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Subjects who have received CTX0E03 DP as part of the active arm in the PISCES III study
